snippet: Prosecutions of both smugglers and those being smuggled were halted on Monday after a judge ruled that a state law does not allow prosecutors to charge immigrants with conspiracy to smuggle themselves.
abstract: Maricopa Country, Ariz, halts prosecutions of both smugglers and those being smuggled after Judge Robert Broomfield of Federal District Court rules that 2005 state law does not allow Sheriff Joe Arpaio or county prosecutors to charge immigrants with conspiracy to smuggle themselves across the border.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutions of both smugglers and those being smuggled were halted on Monday after a judge ruled that a state law does not allow prosecutors to charge immigrants with conspiracy to smuggle themselves.

headline.main: Arizona: Prosecution of Border Smuggling Is Frozen
headline.print_headline: Arizona: Prosecution of Border Smuggling Is Frozen
